utterances: The second aspect of this that we have to deal with is the southbound flows from the United States of both weapons and cash that helps to empower these drug cartels.
The men also talked about climate change and trade between the two countries.
And after a day of meetings, the Obamas hosted the Calderons at the White House for the second state dinner of the Obama presidency.
Security was heightened to prevent a recurrence of the party crashing incident that marred the first such dinner last year.
Ari Shapiro, NPR News, the White House.
The state of Texas held its party primaries yesterday.
Two prominent Republicans were running for governor, and the incumbent, Rick Perry scored an easy win over Senator Kay Bailey Hutchison.
As the night ended, the two bitter rivals were promising to make nice for the good of the party.
NPR's Wade Goodwyn reports.
It was supposed to be a great battle between two powerhouse Republican politicians.
It is exceedingly rare that a sitting U.S.
senator leaves Washington to come home and take on an incumbent governor from the same party.
But Texas Governor Rick Perry left Senator Kay Bailey Hutchinson lying on the canvas and won the Republican primary outright, avoiding the runoff by garnering more than 50 percent.
(Soundbite of cheering)
Thank you.
Thank you.
Thank you.
Last night, Hutchison came down to address her supporters so early in the evening that they couldn't believe she was already throwing in the towel.
From the bottom of my heart, thank you.
But she was.
I have called Governor Perry and congratulated him on his victory.
Now we must unite.
We must win Texas for Republicans and our conservative principles in November.
If the Senator from Texas had trouble demonstrating to the Republican faithful that she had the requisite fire in the belly, Incumbent Rick Perry left little doubt.
Perry warned Hutchison to stay out of the race.
When she challenged him anyway, Perry promised he would make her sorry for her insolence, and last night he did.
During the primary, Perry painted Hutchison as a sold-out Washington politician.
Having dispatched her and Tea Party favorite Debra Medina, Perry continued with his successful line of attack.
From the Salt Lick Barbecue Restaurant outside of Austin, the governor pointed out the enemy.
So from Driftwood, Texas to Washington, D.C., we are sending you a message tonight.
Stop messing with Texas.
(Soundbite of cheering)
Although Perry had just defeated two Republicans rivals in a primary, he described his victory as if it was a triumph over Democrats.
There were a strain of victories that have come along here lately.
There was a victory in New Jersey.
There was a victory in Virginia.
There was a victory in Massachusetts.
And now there has been a victory in Texas.
(Soundbite of cheering)
But Perry's real opponent will not be in Washington, D.C.
Bill White, the popular former mayor of Houston, won an even more resounding victory than Perry.
White defeated Palestinian-born businessman Farouk Shami with more than 75 percent of the vote.
Texas is ready for a new governor.
(Soundbite of cheering)
For more than a decade, Texas Democrats have wondered in the wilderness, unable to garner a single statewide office.
But White, a well-funded moderate, is considered the best hope the party has had since Anne Richards lost her reelection bid to a largely unknown Republican named George W.
Bush.
If Rick Perry would like to make his campaign about Barack Obama, White seems happy to target the Texas governor.
So, if you use your - if you have cruise control, and you're on the highway, use it.

It's going to help improve your fuel mileage, and it's also going to, you know, keep you under the speed limit without having to think about it because cars these days are - they drive so well, it's so easy to go over the speed limit.
You just can't tell.
So if you use your cruise control, you don't have to really think about it.
Mm-hmm.
One thing about driving the speed limit is you're going to have an awful lot of angry drivers right behind you.
Well, just stay on the right side.
You know, they've got the other side to pass you by.
And what I always tell people is if you're on a secondary road, and you do find that you're going on the speed limit and you do get a line behind you, just find a place to pull over and let them go.
Mm-hmm.
The other thing, and I think everybody tells you this, stop driving like a maniac.
Yes.
It's that push and pull of the car, you know, when you are accelerating fast, you're pushing on that gas pedal and pushing a lot of gas through the car.
So you're eating up that gas.
And then you have to, you know, slam on the brakes, and you're eating up your brake pads.
So you're spending money two ways.
Plus, it's not really a safe way to drive.
So all of this, we'll have to find a more - in more detail in just a moment.
But it seems to be that the best device to save gas is yourself.
(Soundbite of laughter)
Correct.
And it's - you know, in the long run, you can - it's just easy.
You can do it all by yourself.
I'm always one of those people, you know, what can I do to make a difference?
And it's nice to know that you can take some steps in your driving habits and save money on your gas.
We're talking with Amy Mattinat of askpatty.com.
If you'd like to join the conversation, 800-989-8255 - 800-989-TALK.
E-mail is talk@npr.org.
What's the best way to save gas?
We have Brandon on the line - Brandon calling us from Pennsylvania.
Hi, how you're doing?
Very well, thanks.

Yeah, I actually heard, I was one of a Web site a couple of months ago, and I heard that if you add acetone - which is nail polish remover - to your gas tank, you can improve mileage by up to 30 percent in some cases.
I'm wondering if that was a myth, or that's a fact or what?
Amy Mattinat?

I would very hesitant to add anything to your gas until it is out there in the public, and all the trade - we call them trade rags - the trade magazine's writing about it and these companies giving it to the dealers and auto repair shops to add it and everybody is on board.
I wouldn't be doing that, because you can do damage.
That gas is going through a lot of parts and pieces in your engine.
And if it's not supposed to be there, you could be doing more damage than saving a little bit in your gas.
And if memory serves, isn't acetone highly volatile?
You know, combustion is, bad things could happen.
(Soundbite of laughter)
Okay then.
Okay, Brandon.
Thanks very much.
Good luck.
Let's see if we can get -this is Maggie.
Maggie's on the line with us from Chicago.
Hi.

I was wondering if your expert could explain if there's something inherently that causes lower mileage with convertibles versus non-convertibles, and if she could make suggestions for minimizing the impact.
I think that's a question of drag again, isn't it?
Yes, it is.
That's a good question.
It's - convertibles are all about fun.
So you have to waive - you know, what is it that you want to be doing?
On a beautiful, sunny day nothing is finer than cruising down the road in your convertible.
And, yes, it is going to cost more in gas mileage, but it's a really fun thing to do.
So it's all about the aerodynamics and the drag of the car and how they're engineered.
So I would say, you know, just enjoy it.
You're not going to be driving with your convertible down everyday unless you live out in California.
But, you know, you have to weigh what's more important to you at the moment.
Oh, you'll look great, Maggie.
And it will feel great.
(Soundbite of laughter)
So putting the top up, will that cut - will that give you better gas mileage then?
Absolutely.
Okay.
But fewer dates.
